hero.lead: From the SMW4 cable (2005) and IMEWE (2010) to the 2014 3G/4G auction, AAE-1 in 2017, PEACE in 2022, and a 5G-ready 2025.

kpis.label: International cable systems (SMW4, IMEWE, AAE-1, PEACE)

timeline.title: SEA-ME-WE 4 ready for service
timeline.text: Primary subsea route to Europe–Middle East–Asia with Pakistan landings; later capacity upgrades.

timeline.title: IMEWE goes commercial
timeline.text: Second high-capacity system adds diversity; PTCL landings strengthen resilience.

timeline.title: First 3G/4G spectrum auction (~US$1.12B)
timeline.text: Kick-starts mass mobile broadband; national LTE/3G roll-out follows.

timeline.title: AAE-1 begins carrying traffic
timeline.text: 25,000 km Asia–Africa–Europe system adds another international path via Karachi.

timeline.title: PEACE Pakistan–Egypt & Mediterranean segments live
timeline.text: Low-latency Karachi ↔ Marseille route enters service, diversifying international capacity.

timeline.title: 142.3m broadband subs; 91% cellular coverage
timeline.text: PTA: 138.7m mobile broadband; 3.6m fixed; ~81% 4G population coverage.

timeline.title: 116m internet users; 45.7% penetration
timeline.text: DataReportal 2025 estimates; Ookla medians: ~20.89 Mbps mobile, ~15.53 Mbps fixed.

points.text: Universal Service Fund–backed rural fibre and 4G expansion remain key to closing the urban–rural access gap.
Local IXPs and CDN caches reduce latency and international transit costs for video, gaming, and e-learning.
Fixed-wireless access (FWA) and FTTH will grow in dense cities where spectrum and rights-of-way are priced sensibly.
SME digitisation needs simple bundles—connectivity + payments + basic cloud—with hands-on onboarding and support.
LEO satellite backhaul can complement terrestrial links in remote districts and during outages/disasters.
Cybersecurity, data-protection, and child-safety enforcement must scale alongside rising connectivity.
e-Government (ID, payments, health, land records) can pull demand if uptime, local-language support, and UX improve.
5G monetisation hinges on enterprise/IoT and FWA use-cases more than handset upgrades; spectrum policy will shape rollout.
